security: Sharing Edward Lansdale's critical views on the Bay of Pigs operation and his account of internal debates could reveal vulnerabilities in the decision-making processes of both the Eisenhower and Kennedy administrations. Lansdale mentions Allen Dulles pleading with him not to 'spoil the plan' and his own skepticism, indicating potential discord and misjudgments at high levels. Quoting directly: 'Allen Dulles brought his planners to a policy group meeting, and they were explaining the concept and my questioning was such that Allen Dulles pleaded with me not to spoil the plan at an early stage.' and 'I was rather critical of the concept, and it was just too clumsy and overt, and a poor-planned feeling.' Disclosing these details could damage the reputation of key figures and the perceived competence of U.S. foreign policy during the Cold War.
summary: This is a transcript of an oral history interview with Edward Lansdale conducted by Dennis O'Brien on July 11, 1970, focusing on Lansdale's involvement with the Bay of Pigs invasion planning during the Eisenhower administration and his subsequent interactions with the Kennedy administration.
summary_one_paragraph: In this oral history interview, Edward Lansdale recounts his involvement in the early planning stages of the Bay of Pigs invasion during the Eisenhower administration, detailing his role as Deputy Assistant to the Secretary of Defense for Special Operations. He expresses concerns about the shift from a guerilla operation to a military invasion, noting Allen Dulles' request to temper his criticisms. Lansdale describes his interactions with incoming Kennedy administration officials, including Robert McNamara and Roswell Gilpatric, and his later consultations with the Maxwell Taylor committee regarding policy decision-making processes. He also reflects on the traumatic impact of the failed invasion on President Kennedy and the shift in influence within government agencies, particularly the rise of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA).
title: ORAL HISTORY WITH EDWARD LANSDALE BY DENNIS O'BRIEN
